title: Bug 18915[Preferences] Switching between erroneous preferences pages should generate error, not warning.
OB: When entering invalid data on any preference page and receiving a red flag on the UI, trying to select another page without fixing the problem results in a warning dialog that says, 'The currently displayed page contains invalid values.'
EB: When entering invalid data on any preference page and trying to select another page without fixing the problem, an error dialog should be displayed instead of a warning. The error dialog should clearly indicate that one is not allowed to leave the page without fixing the mistake.
SR:
To reproduce this issue:
1. Go to any preference page in the application.
2. Enter invalid data on the page so that it triggers a red flag on the UI.
3. Try to select another preference page without correcting the invalid data.
4. Observe that a warning dialog is displayed, indicating that the currently displayed page contains invalid values. This should be an error dialog instead.
